From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To set the terminal receive speed (how fast information is sent to the terminal) for the current line and session, use the **terminal rxspeed** command in EXEC mode.

ParaDef.Info: Baud rate in bits per second (bps). The default is 9600.

Examples: The following example sets the current auxiliary line receive speed to 115200 <bps>:
ExtraInfo: Set the speed to match the baud rate of whatever device you have connected to the port. Some baud rates available on devices connected to the port might not be supported on the system. The system will indicate if the speed you select is not supported.

RelatedCmds.description: Sets the terminal receive speed for a specified line or lines.
Sets the terminal receive speed for the current session.
Sets the terminal transmit speed for a specified line or lines.
Sets the transmit and receive speeds for the current session.
